description: From Middle English benefactor, borrowed from Medieval Latin benefactor (“he who bestows a favor”), from Latin benefaciō (“benefit someone”), from bene (“good”) + faciō (“do, make”).

nouns.description: benefactor (plural benefactors, feminine benefactress or benefactoress or benefactrix)

entries.meaning: Somebody who gives a gift, often money to a charity.
Someone who performs good or noble deeds.
